name: Green Smoothie
description: Energy-boosting vitamin smoothie with spinach, banana, and tropical fruits. Tastes great despite the green color!

instructions.instruction: Add spinach to blender. Pour in almond milk.
instructions.tip: Blending greens with liquid first yields smoother result.

instructions.instruction: Blend on high 30 seconds. Spinach should be completely broken down.
Peel and break banana into pieces, add to blender.
instructions.tip: Frozen banana makes smoothie cold and creamy.

instructions.instruction: Add chia seeds and optional ginger.
Add ice cubes if using fresh fruit.
Blend on high 1-2 minutes until completely smooth.
instructions.tip: Check consistency - add more milk if too thick.

instructions.instruction: Taste and add honey if needed. Pour into glasses and serve immediately.
instructions.tip: Letting it sit causes oxidation and darker color.

tips: Spinach taste is masked by tropical fruits - even non-veggie-lovers enjoy it.
Frozen fruit is economical and eliminates need for ice.
Add protein powder for breakfast replacement.
Pre-portion spinach in bags and freeze for easy prep.
Green color may look scary but taste is amazing!
storageInfo: Best fresh. Can refrigerate 24 hours max - shake before drinking.
servingSuggestion: Drink for breakfast, pre-workout, or as afternoon energy boost.
variations: Use kale instead of spinach - more nutrients.
Add avocado for creamier texture and healthy fats.
Add peanut butter for protein and flavor.
Add cocoa powder for chocolate green smoothie.
